title: Component Internationalization
description: Component-level translation overrides for multi-language support. PRIMARY APPROACH: Use $t:key syntax in content/children to reference centralized translations (defined in languages.translations). FALLBACK APPROACH: Use this i18n object only for component-specific overrides that differ from centralized translations. Precedence: per-component i18n → centralized $t: → fallback language.

examples._comment: PRIMARY APPROACH: Centralized translations with $t: references
examples.result: Button displays 'Save' in English, 'Enregistrer' in French - translations come from centralized dictionary, no per-component i18n needed

examples._comment: HYBRID APPROACH: $t: reference with per-component override
examples.result: Per-component i18n overrides centralized translation - displays 'Submit Payment' instead of generic 'Submit'. Use for context-specific variations.

examples._comment: FALLBACK APPROACH: Per-component i18n only (legacy pattern, avoid for new code)
examples.result: Only use per-component i18n when translation is truly unique and won't be reused. Prefer $t: for better maintainability.
